sense.name: one hundredth of a base unit of currency
sense.commentary: PENNY[+artifact][+currency][+coin][+copper] [+quantity][+currency][+unit][+portion][+hundredth] Note: emphasis is on the actual coin, or its unit value as a currency
sense.examples: There are one hundred pennies in a US dollar. John found a lucky penny in the street. You can probably not buy anything nowadays with just a single penny. The child put pennies, dimes and nickels into his piggy bank.

sense.name: an unspecified sum of money
sense.commentary: PENNY[+quantity][+sum][-specified][+high/+low] Note: refers to a vague sum of money, not the unit of the currency.
sense.examples: Bob's Porsche must have cost him a pretty penny. I won't give another penny to that organization after what they did. You wind up spending a penny here, a penny there, so it does start to add up. For only pennies a day, you could provide food and medicine to a needy child.
